title: What are the benefits of transferring "partial interest in the property transferred"? And what's the minimum that is partial?
question: My mother wants my name on the grant deed. I have bad debt. Will collectors put a lean on the house? I have really bad credit will bankruptcy help or hurt the situation. I plan to go finish 1 last year of college. I currently work part time.
answers:
Your question is very unclear. It sounds like your mother wants to transfer a "partial interest" in her property to you. A partial interest is anything that is less than the entire interest (so anywhere from 0.000001% to 99.999999%).

But why is she thinking about doing this? Without more information it's impossible to know what she perceives to be an advantage.

If your credit is bad, then there is a distinct possibility that your creditors would try to place a lien on your mother's property (or to be precise on your interest in your mother's property). If you mother wants to give you an interest in the property, she would be far wiser to do so by placing the gift to you in a "spendthrift" trust that would help insulate you from creditors' claims.
